page.title: 09Churches In Sheffield
page.content: In 1881 there were many churches and chapels in{Brightside}but by 1985 things have changed. The large{chapel which could hold 600 people on Dearne Street is now a car park. Next door the old{Sunday School}building has recently been converted to a furniture warehouse and is reputedly haunted. The{Parish Church}of St. Thomas's Brightside, built in 1854, stands in an overgrown churchyard and is home to the Sheffield School of Gymnastics. St. Margaret's{C of E}built during the 1920's is still used for worship but looks untidy and neglected outside. A{Methodist}Shop and Mission Centre stands on Birdwell Road where Sunday Services and many community activities are regularly held. On Wincobank Lane a former chapel has recently been converted into the Madni Masjid {Islamic Community Centre.
